name: Norway
description: A Scandinavian country known for its stunning landscapes, used as a filming location for various films.

content.title: Overview
content.body: **Norway** is a Scandinavian country encompassing vast wilderness, mountains, glaciers, and deep coastal fjords. The capital, Oslo, is a city of green spaces and museums. Norway is known for its vibrant cultural life, natural beauty, and as an adventure tourism hotspot.

content.title: Film History
content.body: Norway has served as a breathtaking backdrop for multiple film productions. Notably, *Star Wars: Episode V – The Empire Strikes Back* filmed scenes in Norway, specifically the snowy landscapes of the Hardangerjøkulen Glacier, doubling for the ice planet Hoth. The film *The Wave* (Bølgen), a disaster movie based on a true-story rockslide-induced tsunami, was filmed along the scenic edges of the Geirangerfjord. Other movies include *Ex Machina*, where the secluded setting reflects the isolation required for the film's narrative, and *Tenet*, which filmed some sequences in Oslo and the stunning Rjukan waterfall.

content.title: Visiting
content.body: Norway is highly accessible to tourists, offering a range of public transport options including buses, trains, and ferries. Many tourist companies provide guided tours to iconic fjords, northern lights experiences, and historic site visits. As a popular destination, it has ample tourist infrastructure catering to international visitors. Key filming locations like the fjords and major cities like Oslo are highlighted in various tourism packages.
